questions.question: A random sample of 500 apples was taken from a large consignment and 60 were found to be bad. What is the sample proportion of bad apples?

A manufacturer claims that 20% of the manufactured products is of good quality. In one day's production of 400 products, only 40 are of good quality. While testing this problem, what will be the alternative hypothesis?

answers.a: P > 0.2 where P is population proportion
answers.b: P < 0.2 where P is population proportion
answers.c: P = 0.2 where P is population proportion
answers.d: P ≠ 0.2 where P is population proportion
